examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to hold, possess, or own an object or a quality
words.defineVi: để giữ, sở hữu, hoặc sở hữu một đối tượng hoặc một chất lượng

examples: That shot lost him the championship.
lose that creep!
His carelessness lost him the job.
The government has lost control of the city.
The business is losing money.
words.defineEn: to be deprived of or stop having someone or something
words.defineVi: bị tước đoạt hoặc ngừng có một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
The car met the bus head-on.
He met his death in 1946.
I meet my study group at the library on Tuesday afternoons.
We usually meet at the coffee shop on Fridays.
words.defineEn: to come together in a place with others to do something special
words.defineVi: đến với nhau ở một nơi với những người khác để làm điều gì đó đặc biệt

examples: Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
Which team won?
The proposal has won the approval of the city council.
Our team actually won!
words.defineEn: to become the most successful, the luckiest, or the best in a game, race, fight, etc.
words.defineVi: để trở thành người thành công nhất, may mắn nhất hoặc giỏi nhất trong một trò chơi, cuộc đua, cuộc chiến, v.v.

examples: The town is three miles away.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
words.defineEn: used when naming, or giving description or information about people, things, or situations
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi đặt tên hoặc đưa ra mô tả hoặc thông tin về người, sự vật hoặc tình huống

examples: Does this pub do lunches?
Does this pub do lunches?
Does the price include tax?
Microprocessors do the calculations in the twinkling of an eye.
The gang did a warehouse and a supermarket.
words.defineEn: to perform an action or activity that is not mentioned by name
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một hành động hoặc hoạt động không được đề cập theo tên

examples: The factory employee was eating lunc in the cafeteria.
so I ate my fill.
I eat pizza on Wednesdays.
I ate a delicious apple for a healthy snack.
I ate a handful of sweet grapes for a refreshing snack.
words.defineEn: to put food into the mouth, then chew and swallow it
words.defineVi: để đưa thức ăn vào miệng, sau đó nhai và nuốt nó

examples: His frame spoke tiredness.
He spoke the final words of the play.
The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
My mother spoke Russian.
Please speak more slowly.
words.defineEn: to use one's voice to express a particular feeling or to communicate information
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của một người để thể hiện một cảm giác cụ thể hoặc để truyền đạt thông tin

examples: All newspapers sang from the same song sheet.
We sang songs to pass the time.
She can't sing for toffee.
Every night she sings the baby to sleep.
Cheerleaders from both schools sang the National Anthem before the start of the game and there were chills down my spine.
words.defineEn: to use our voice in order to produce musical sounds in the form of a tune or song
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của chúng tôi để tạo ra âm thanh âm nhạc dưới dạng một giai điệu hoặc bài hát
